intro: Dicarpaea linifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf dicarpaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with each leaflet being slender and lance-shaped. Dicarpaea linifolia is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its natural habitat.
